relation: IMPORTANT: If you have a blog on JustBento...
pageTitle: Dietary advice for pregnant women in Japan? | Just Bento Community Forum
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {26072=I found this page (English) on the Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare site: Advice for Pregnant Women on Fish Consumption concerning Mercury Contamination. This has a list of fish consumed in Japan that is deemed to have high mercury levels, which should be eaten sparingly if at all by pregnant women. That list is from 2001 though - this Japanese page is a bit more up to date. Basically if you aren't eating dolphin(!) and whale(!) the fish to eat sparingly would be various kinds of tuna, yellow porgy, maybe some types of cod., 31290=Eating more than before is rather difficult at the moment. Just keeping what I eat down is a challenge so I'm trying to make every mouthful count, nutritionally speaking. But I'm hoping that I'll be feeling better by April., 35246=My bento blog: http://justbento.com/blog/1305 My art blog: http://jizaacaso.deviantart.com}
